snippet: While the world may be dazzled by Chinese students’ test scores, educators in China worry that the lack of hands-on science learning is stifling innovation and critical thinking.
abstract: Chinese science educators are beginning to worry that focus on test-taking and lack of hands-on science is stifling students' innovation and critical thinking; increasing numbers of middle-class families are seeking way out of country's test-taking gauntlet by sending students overseas for schooling, with many coming to the United States.
lead_paragraph: While the world may be dazzled by Chinese students’ test scores, educators in China worry that the lack of hands-on science learning is stifling innovation and critical thinking.

headline.main: Chinese Educators Look to American Classrooms
